column4: anyone know how to trouble shoot a problem mounting an sata drive in gparted? i keep getting a input/output error
I/O error usualy means dead hardware
the hardware is most certainly not dead, though
oh, it works on other OSs/machines
it's my SATA drive, right
drivers probably
so if its a drivers conflict do i look for drivers for my SATA controller?
i would think so
the disk is internal??
right, it's an SATA 300 gb seagate drive
the controller is built into the motherboard
oh really?
so i'm screwed if i try to use this drive?
ya i figured as much
lol, then what's up
ya? wot?
LOL, nice
did you just say that cause you have had bad luck with seagates or just to confuse me ;<
damn!
arggh i want to install ubuntu :( :(
anyway u would probably need MoBo drivers
